clinical_study.brief_title: Genotyping and Phenotyping of CYP2D6 Breast Cancer Patients on Tamoxifen
clinical_study.official_title: Genotyping and Phenotyping of CYP2D6 as Predictor of Z-endoxifen Plasma Levels in Breast Cancer Patients on Tamoxifen Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: This study is an observational study to determine phenotype and genotype of CYP2D6 as predictors of z-endoxifen concentrations in plasma of outgoing patients treated with tamoxifen for at least 4 months

detailed_description.textblock:
Tamoxifen is an antiestrogen drug with concentration dependent properties, with z-endoxifen known as active metabolite. Until know therapeutic range for z-endoxifen to improve treatment response was not known. Variation response on tamoxifen can be cause of genetic polymorphism CYP2D6 that can be different between interindividul and ethnic.
The aim of this study is to determine phenotype and genotype of CYP2D6 as predictors of z-endoxifen concentrations in plasma of outgoing patients treated with tamoxifen for at least 4 months

primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with CYP2D6 genotype and phenotype who had steady state level

secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with plasma levels of Z-endoxifen more than 5.9 ng/mL

arm_group.description: Patients currently on treatment with tamoxifen for at least 4 months.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples from breast cancer patients treated with Z-endoxifen were drawn for analysis of genotype and phenotype of CYP2D6, as well as the plasma concentration of Z-endoxifen

study_pop.textblock: Outpatient breast cancer patients on tamoxifen treatment for at least 4 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Breast cancer patients on tamoxifen treatment for at least 4 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Abnormalities in liver markers (AST >2.5 x ULN)
